thread.title: High school roundup: Queensbury tops Broadalbin-Perth in boys' soccer
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Queensbury tops Broadalbin-Perth in boys' soccer - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Queensbury tops Broadalbin-Perth in boys' soccer
text:
Queensbury improved to 10-5-1 on the season with a 2-1 victory over Broadalbin-Perth on Saturday in a boys' soccer nonleague Foothills Council crossover contest at Queensbury.
Following a scoreless first half, Queensbury jumped on the scoreboard on a goal by senior midfielder John Meacham to take a 1-0 lead. The Spartans increased the advantage to 2-0 when senior Cole Crotty tucked home Eddie Gardner 's pass.
Austin Famiglietti scored a late goal for Broadalbin-Perth to cut the lead to 2-1.
The Patriots dropped to 10-4-1 with the loss.
More boys' soccer: Colonie nipped Guilderland, 2-1, in a Suburban Council game at Guilderland. Zack Turnbull and Marco Curto scored goals for the Garnet Raiders while Ben Couture had the only goal for the Dutchmen. Colonie outshot Guilderland, 6-5.
Girls' soccer: Scotia topped South Glens Falls, 1-0, to win the Foothills Council championship game. Myah Hughes scored the game's only goal to lead the Tartans, who moved to a perfect 16-0 overall.
Cross country: The Colonie girls' team took first place at the 33rd Annual Brown University Championship at Goddard Park in Providence, R.I. Kathryn Tenney had a second-place finish with a time of 17 minutes, 55 seconds to lead the Garnet Raiders. Amanda Chambers was sixth with a time of 18:34.
